Option B. Subdural hemorrhage: Subdural hemorrhage presents with symptoms of increased intracranial pressure such as headache, altered level of consciousness, and focal neurological deficits, and may manifest as a crescent-shaped hyperdensity on CT brain imaging.

 

Option C. Cerebral contusion: Cerebral contusion refers to bruising of the brain tissue and typically presents with focal neurological deficits corresponding to the area of contusion. CT brain imaging may reveal areas of hyperdensity or hypodensity depending on the stage of the contusion.

 

Educational objective:

 

  • Diffuse axonal injury is a severe form of traumatic brain injury characterized by widespread axonal damage due to rotational forces.
  • Diagnosis may be challenging on CT imaging, but it should be suspected in patients with high-impact trauma, altered level of consciousness, and decerebrate or decorticate posturing.
  • MRI is more sensitive for detecting diffuse axonal injury, especially in cases where CT findings are normal.

questions.text: A patient is receiving linezolid treatment for an extended period due to a complicated infection. What should be monitored if linezolid is administered for more than 14 days to ensure patient safety and manage potential side effects?
questions.solution:
Ans. D) Platelet count

 

  • Linezolid, an oxazolidinone antibiotic, is used for treating infections caused by Gram-positive bacteria, including those resistant to other antibiotics.
  • A significant potential side effect of linezolid, especially when used for periods longer than 14 days, is thrombocytopenia.
  • This condition involves a decrease in platelets, which are critical for proper blood clotting.
  • Monitoring the platelet count is essential to detect this potentially serious side effect early and adjust treatment as necessary to prevent complications such as excessive bleeding.

 

Other Options:

 

Option A. Kidney function test: While monitoring kidney function is important for many drugs, linezolid is not specifically known for causing nephrotoxicity, making this less relevant compared to platelet monitoring.

 

Option B. Audiometry: Monitoring hearing, or audiometry, is generally not required with linezolid. Audiometry is more relevant for drugs known to cause ototoxicity, such as certain aminoglycoside antibiotics.

 

Option C. Liver function tests: Although monitoring liver function is critical for drugs metabolized through the liver and those known for causing hepatotoxicity, linezolid is not specifically associated with liver damage, making platelet count monitoring more pertinent in this case.

 

Educational Objective:

 

  • Monitoring platelet count is crucial when administering linezolid for more than 14 days due to the risk of thrombocytopenia.
  • This monitoring helps ensure early detection and management of this potential side effect, maintaining patient safety during prolonged treatment.

questions.text: A 55-year-old man presents to the clinic with a history of intermittent abdominal pain and unintentional weight loss over the past few months. Upon further evaluation, he is found to have multiple enhancing liver masses on imaging studies. Which of the following given cancers is least likely to metastasize to the liver?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Prostate

 

  • Prostate cancer tends to metastasize to bones rather than the liver. Bone metastases are a hallmark of advanced prostate cancer. Liver metastases from prostate cancer are relatively rare compared to bone metastases.

 

Other Options:

 

Option A. Colon: Colon cancer commonly metastasizes to the liver. The liver is one of the most common sites of metastasis for colon cancer, and it frequently spreads to the liver through the portal vein.

 

Option B. Breast: Breast cancer can metastasize to various organs, including the liver. Liver metastases in breast cancer are not uncommon, and the liver is considered a potential site of spread for breast cancer cells.

 

Option D. Melanoma: Melanoma is known for its propensity to metastasize to various organs, including the liver. Liver metastases are common in advanced melanoma cases.

 

Educational Objective:

 

  • Prostate Cancers rarely metastasize to the liver.

questions.text: A microbiology technician is performing routine stool cultures on MacConkey agar to identify and classify bacteria from the family Enterobacteriaceae based on their lactose fermentation properties. A sample yields colonies that initially appear colorless at 24 hours but turn pink after 48 hours of incubation. Based on this information, which group of Enterobacteriaceae does the organism likely belong to?
questions.solution:
Ans. C) Late lactose fermenters (LLF)

 

  • Late lactose fermenters, also previously known as paracolon bacilli, ferment lactose slowly, typically taking 2 to 8 days to show a positive reaction.
  • On MacConkey agar, these organisms initially produce pale or colorless colonies within the first 24 hours of incubation.
  • By the second day or later, the colonies turn pink, indicating delayed lactose fermentation. This is characteristic of the late lactose fermenters group.

 

Other Options:

 

Option A. Lactose fermenters (LF): Rapidly ferment lactose and produce pink-colored colonies on MacConkey agar within 24 hours.

 

Option B. Nonlactose fermenters (NLF): do not ferment lactose and consistently produce pale or colorless colonies, even after extended incubation.

 

Option D. None of the above: This is incorrect as the correct answer is available in the provided options.

 

Educational Objective:
